wikipedia_page.main: Percy Downes (19 September 1905 – 1989) was an English professional footballer. He spent six years at Blackpool in the early 20th century, making over 150 Football League appearances for the club, and over 350 league appearances in total. He played as a midfielder.

response: From the start of the 1930s, Stockport County played in a home kit of white and black and were nicknamed the 'Lilywhites'. In the 1933–34 season they scored 115 goals; a 13–0 home win over Halifax Town on 6 January 1934 included a Joe Hill hat-trick and four goals from Percy Downes. During the season, Alf Lythgoe scored a club-record 46 goals for Stockport,Nelson, p.25Freeman & Harnwell, p.34 and Stockport's 2–1 home defeat on 9 December 1933 to Crystal Palace in the second round of the 1933–34 FA Cup was televised. Stockport finished third that season.

The league season began on 31 August with a visit to Bloomfield Road by Millwall. The hosts won 4–3, with goals from Percy Downes, Dick Neal, Jimmy Hampson and Alex Ritchie, in front of a crowd of 15,760.

Very few additions were made to the squad during the season, with only Charles Broadhurst and Percy Downes joining the Bloomfield Road staff. The players spent the subsequent summer months enjoying civic receptions and dinners held in their honour.
